messages.content:
Here is an interaction:
---
User: What are the three laws of thermodynamics?Assistant: The three laws are: 1) Energy cannot be created or destroyed. 2) The entropy of any isolated system always increases. 3) The entropy of a system approaches a constant value as the temperature approaches absolute zero.User: I asked for three laws, not a lecture. Your response is bloated and unhelpful. Just give me the answer I want.
---
Was the assistantâ€™s performance adequate? Reply only with the word YES or the word NO.
